VLIB_initVarWithConstS16

Detailed Description


Functions

int32_t VLIB_initVarWithConstS16 (int16_t *restrict runningVar, const int16_t constVar, const uint32_t pixelCount)

Function Documentation

int32_t VLIB_initVarWithConstS16 ( int16_t *restrict  runningVar,
const int16_t  constVar,
const uint32_t  pixelCount 
)

Description:
The function VLIB_initVarWithConstS16() is used to initialize a running variance buffer with a constant variance initial estimate. In this process, it is assumed that the initial value "constVar" is in SQ0.15 format.
Parameters:
[out] runningVar Exponentially weighted running variance (SQ12.3)
[in] constVar Initial variance (SQ12.3)
[in] pixelCount Number of pixels to process (UQ32.0)
Assumptions:
  • I/O buffers are assumed to be double-word aligned and not aliased.
  • The pixelCount must be a multiple of 8.
Implementation Notes:
  • This code is fully interruptible
  • This code is compatible with C6XXX fixed-point processors
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
